page.title: 17HARDEN AND HAINWORTH MOORS 1
page.content: The general{topography}of the area is that of{high level pasture}rising to moorland of mean altitude of 1000'. An O.S.Triangulation point (068384) on {Catstone Hill}provides a vantage point for views as distant as the{Three {Peaks}to the N.W.,{York Minster}to the E.,{Emley Moor transmitter}to the S.E. and the surrounding{Pennine Hills}and moorland in other directions. Nearby is{Catstone Circle}which is an{Iron Age}earthwork, believed to have been either a hill fort or farm. There are numerous derelict sandstone{quarries}which once supplied the stone for the building boom of the {Industrial Revolution}in the Keighley area. Two quarries still operate in the area:{Shaw quarry}and{Midgeham {quarry. }Some of the disused quarries are being used for infill sites and land reclaimation.
